data.title: General Surgery Residency
data.meta_description: Meet the General Surgery Residents at Trinity Health Oakland.
data.text:
Haley Lanser (Chief PGY V)

Haley was born and raised in central Illinois and went to medical school at Chicago College of Osteopathic Medicine. She chose Trinity Health Oakland for residency because of elevated resident experience and wonderful resident camaraderie that makes it feel like home. Her surgical interests are minimally invasive and bariatric surgery. In her free time, she enjoys exploring new places, traveling, the great outdoors, and baking lots of yummy desserts.

Michael Maiden (Chief PGY V)

Michael was born and raised outside of Boston. He went to Northeastern University for his undergraduate education, completed his Master of Arts at Loyola University Chicago, and completed his medical training at Des Moines University. Michael chose St. Joseph's to be close to his girlfriend, the attending surgeons that he would receive training from and the broad operative experience. He is unsure of what he would like to train in at this time (being an intern) but he really enjoys colorectal surgery. In his free time, Michael likes to play basketball, watch every NBA game religiously and read his favorite book - Sabistons.

Kyle Barnhart (PGY IV)

Kyle is from Cartersville, Ga (about an hour outside of Atlanta) and went to Georgia Tech for undergrad where he majored in biochemistry. After graduation, Kyle was employed as a chemical and research engineer before returning to graduate school for a Masterâ€™s degree and eventually his MD from Mercer University School of Medicine. Kyle chose St. Joes because of the early operative experience, close camaraderie of the residents, and the smaller community focus of the program. His surgical interest lies in trauma and critical care and he plans to pursue a critical care fellowship. In his spare time, Kyle is an avid home-brewer and dabbles in woodworking. Kyle is also an enthusiastic outdoorsman and enjoys hunting, hiking, camping, and scuba diving.

Adam Sobilo (PGY IV)

Adam grew up in Rochester Hills, MI and received his undergraduate degree from The University of Michigan. He completed medical school at Central Michigan University College of Medicine. Adam enjoys the robust and operating room experience at Trinity Health Oakland as well as working with a cohesive and supportive group of co-residents and teaching faculty. Adam is a huge car enthusiast and loves cruising Woodward Avenue on his way home from the hospital. He also enjoys practicing karate, cooking, playing video games, and taking naps.

Mark Glover (PGY III)

Mark was born and raised in Geneva, Switzerland up until the age of 3. The majority of his childhood was spent in Brazil before moving to Ft. Lauderdale, FL at the age of 14. Mark can speak English, Portuguese, Spanish, and Swiss German. He graduated from Nova Southeastern University with a BS in Biology and minors in Accounting and Mathematics. He then went on to Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine (LECOM) in Bradenton, FL for medical school, where General Surgery caught his attention. In his spare time, he enjoys going to the gym, watching Tottenham Hotspurs, and traveling. Most importantly, he loves spending time with his wife, Alexandra, and their dog named Bronco.

Mulin Xiong (PGY III)

Mulin grew up in the Metro Detroit and greater Boston areas. She went to Dartmouth College for undergrad and Michigan State College of Human Medicine for medical school. She chose Trinity Health Oakland for the breadth and depth of surgical experiences, diverse patient population, and close friendship of a small residency program. In her free time, she enjoys exploring new restaurants, reading, and traveling.

Ryan Korlewitz (PGY II)

Ryan is from Grand Rapids, Michigan. He attended Westmont College in Santa Barbara, California for his undergraduate degree and after 4 years in the sun, headed back home for his medical education at MSUCOM. In his free time Ryan loves to play golf, tennis, travel, scuba dive, and cheer on the Spartans. Ryan is excited to be at Trinity Health Oakland and hopes to eventually pursue a fellowship in plastics, cardiothoracic surgery, or trauma.

Harleen Aujla (PGY I)

Harleen was born and raised in Mumbai, India before she moved to Indiana at the age of 15. She went to Indiana University Northwest for undergrad and Marian University College of Osteopathic Medicine for medical school. She is delighted to be a part of Trinity Health Oakland because of the excellent operative experience and resident camaraderie that exists in this residency program. Her surgical interests are in cardiothoracic and vascular surgery. In her free time, Harleen likes working out, biking, hiking, cooking, and reading fiction novels.

Corey Suthumphong (PGY I)

Corey is originally from West Palm Beach, Florida. He went to undergraduate school at the University of Miami and medical school at Florida International University Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine. He is currently completing a preliminary year in surgery. Afterwards, Corey will pursue general surgery and is interested in a critical care fellowship. In his free time, Corey enjoys home improvement, hiking, and watching car reviews.

Kristin Hardy (PGY I - Preliminary)

Kristin Hardy was born and raised in Columbia, South Carolina and graduated from Loyola University Chicago - Stritch School of Medicine. In the future, she plans to become an anesthesiologist or a surgeon! In her free time, she enjoys watching and reading true crime, exercising, experimenting with new health trends, and giving my dog plenty of belly rubs.

Taj Rai (PGY I - Preliminary)

Taj was born and raised in southern California. He completed his undergraduate degree in biochemistry at California State University, San Bernardino. He went on to complete medical school at Western University of Health Sciences, Pomona. Taj is excited about training at Trinity Health Oakland for the supportive camaraderie and location in pure Michigan. He is most eager to become a well-rounded general surgeon with interests in critical care and trauma. In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his wife, distance running, keeping up with the NFL, and watching Harry Potter movies.

Bryan Roberts (PGY I - Preliminary)

Bryan was born and raised in Appleton, Wisconsin, a suburban city in Northeast Wisconsin (where the great escape artist Harry Houdini grew up and considered his home). Bryan went to University of Wisconsin-Madison, where he completed his undergraduate degree in Medical Microbiology & Immunology. He then attended A.T. Still University-Kirksville College of Osteopathic Medicine (Missouri) to complete his medical degree. During medical school, he also completed a pre-doctoral academic fellowship in Osteopathic Manipulative Medicine. He will be attending Wayne State University Anesthesiology program next year and has current interests in Cardiothoracic or Critical Care Anesthesia. In his free time, he loves to train for and perform in trail running/obstacle races such as Tough Mudder and Spartan Race, drum, support the Green Bay Packers, and spend time with family/friends.

Sai Santosh Sreenvisan (PGY I - Preliminary)

Santosh was born in India and raised in both the US and Kuwait City, Kuwait. He spent the majority of his childhood in Kuwait before coming back to the United States to attend Goucher College in Towson, MD for his undergraduate studies in Biological Sciences. After graduating with Honors, he chose to complete a year of Malaria Vaccine research for the US Army at the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research before starting Medical School. An aspiring surgeon since high school, he completed his medical studies at the Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine (LECOM) at Seton Hill. He continues to pursue his dream of becoming a surgeon par excellence. Owing to his upbringing abroad, Santosh is Multilingual, and speaks 5 languages: English, Hindi, French, Tamil and Telugu, along with basic Arabic that he picked up growing up in Kuwait. In his free time, he enjoys listening to and creating music as an accomplished Indian Classical musician. He also enjoys hiking, traveling, road trips, watching and critiquing movies, watching football, soccer and cricket, hanging out with friends, and exploring new eateries!
